subject: p15131736
History: Yo female with a history of COPD on2-5L home O2 FEV1 , HFpEF, IDDM, MDR UTI, recurrent cellulitis with recent admission for colitis c/b shock requiring MICU stay, presented with worsening dyspnea on exertion, eval for pulmonary edema.
Findings: Lung volumes are low, similar when compared to the prior study. Even allowing for the projection, the heart is enlarged. There is prominence of the pulmonary vasculature which appears hazy consistent with a degree of congestive heart failure. No overt pulmonary edema seen. Left lower lobe atelectasis, unchanged. No consolidation or pneumothorax seen.
Impression: Findings consistent with congestive heart failure. Appearances are grossly unchanged compared to the prior study.
